intro: Chrysanthemum apetalum, commonly known as the spoonleaf chrysanthemum, is a perennial herb native to East Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive spoon-shaped leaves and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants. Chrysanthemum apetalum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
